articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Congratulations to Egyptian President
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Congratulations to Egyptian President
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- General secretary Kim Jong Il sent a congratulatory message to Muhammad Hosni Mubarak, chairman of the National Democratic Party of Egypt and president of the Arab Republic of Egypt, Sunday on his birthday.
					 The message said:
					
					 Please accept my warm congratulations to you on your birthday.
					
					 Availing myself of this opportunity, I sincerely wish you good health and success in your work.

articles.title: Greetings to Egyptian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Egyptian President
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on May 3 sent a message of greetings to Muhammad Hosni Mubarak, President of the Arab Republic of Egypt, on his 81st birthday.
					 Kim in the message extended warm felicitations to him, expressing hope that he would make greater success in his work to achieve the development and prosperity of the country and promote the Arab unity and seek a fair and comprehensive settlement of the Mideast issue and always enjoy good health and happiness.

articles.title: U.S. and Lee Group’s Reckless War Moves under Fire
articles.content:
U.S. and Lee Group’s Reckless War Moves under Fire
Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- Some days ago, the commander of the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces in south Korea blustered that the s. Korea-U.S. mutual defense pact would remain valid and the U.S. would remain firmly committed to providing a nuclear umbrella although the "right to command wartime operations" is transferred to south Korea. 
					He unhesitatingly let loose bellicose remarks that south Korea and the U.S. would "maintain the prompt combat readiness through "OPLAN 5027" and "OPLAN 5029," disclosing that the operation plan to cope with "any situation" is in the making together with the puppet joint chiefs of staff and asserting that "exercises have already been conducted under this plan and its immediate application is possible in contingency."
					
					 Those concerned of the south Korean puppet army said it is expected to report the developed plan to the Chongwadae by the end of this month and they are at the phase of having rounded off the plan in which the counter-proposal has been specified.
					
					 A spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea in a statement on Sunday bitterly denounced the bellicose remarks made by the commander of the U.S. forces in south Korea and the moves for a war of aggression against the north stepped up by the south Korean puppets echoing them as a declaration of full-scale military confrontation with the DPRK and dangerous and reckless moves to spark off a nuclear war after bringing the inter-Korean relations to total collapse.
					
					 Accusing the U.S. and the Lee Myung Bak group of frantically kicking up rackets of confrontation with the DPRK and a war of aggression against it, getting vociferous in describing the DPRK's  satellite launch for peaceful purposes as a sort of "provocation, threat and violation of a UN resolution" and the like, the statement went on:
					
					 The present situation goes to clearly prove that the U.S. hostile policy towards the DPRK has not changed at all and that the Lee Myung Bak group is a group of wicked traitors and warmongers keen to impose a nuclear war disaster upon the Korean nation in collusion with outside forces.
					
					 Now that the sinister intention of the U.S. and the south Korean puppets playing the role of a shock brigade for it has been brought to bold relief, the DPRK will go straight in the direction of bolstering up its nuclear deterrent for self-defence as it had already clarified. 
					
					 The U.S. and the Lee group had better stop at once their reckless moves for a war, properly understanding who their rival is.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group's Fascist Actions Flayed
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group's Fascist Actions Flayed
Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Democratic Lawyers Association of Korea in its statement issued on Sunday vehemently condemned together with all Koreans the Lee Myung Bak group for perpetrating fascist actions against democracy and reunification in a bid to stamp out the reunification movement in south Korea by indiscriminately invoking the "National Security Law," a product of the fascist dictatorship, in gross violation of the north-south declarations. 
					 Traitor Lee's harsh suppression of the Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration in south Korea by labeling its patriotic activities as "illegal ones" is an undisguised denial of the north-south declarations and the idea of "By our nation itself" and cannot be construed otherwise than a despicable behavior of  anti-reunification maniacs that brought to light once again the true colors of those keen on permanent national split and confrontation, the statement said, and continued:
					
					 The reality of south Korea clearly proves that there can be no freedom of activities for social progress and national reunification in south Korea, to say nothing of elementary human rights, as long as traitor Lee stays in power and the NSL which labels fellow countrymen in the north as "an enemy" remains in force.
					
					 It is none other than the Lee group of traitors who should be brought to the court of history to face a stern judgment of the nation.
					
					 The Lee group should immediately repeal the NSL which stirs up confrontation with compatriots, lift the label of "enemy benefiting organization" attached to the reunification movement organizations and acquit the unreasonably detained patriotic personages at once.
					
					 The group of traitors will face a stern punishment by all Koreans desirous of reunification should it continue cracking down upon the forces supporting the June 15 declaration, defying the unanimous protest and denunciation of the public at home and abroad.

articles.title: Collection of Reminiscences "Among the People" Vol. 80 Off Press
articles.content:
Collection of Reminiscences "Among the People" Vol. 80 Off Press
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- The Workers' Party of Korea Publishing House brought out the collection of Reminiscences "Among the People" Vol. 80.
					 The book contains 20 reminiscences telling about the immortal exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung for the prosperity of the country, people's well-being and the country's reunification and his noble popular traits.
					
					 Among them are reminiscences dealing with the facts that the President visited the Korean Revolution Museum and underscored the need to intensify the education of masses in order to firmly arm the party members and other working people with the revolutionary traditions of the WPK and initiated a project for the expansion of the production capacity of the then February 8 Vinalon Factory to solve the problem of people's clothing and wisely led it.
					
					 The book also contains reminiscences telling stories that the President implanted ardent patriotism into the scientists of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, exerted great efforts to make sure that Wonsan City was built into a modern port city and led the work for preserving and managing well the historic relics and materials associated with the wisdom and soul of the Koreans.
					
					 The book carries reminiscences dealing with facts that he reposed trust in officials in the field of agriculture by helping them build the socialist rural areas better generation after generation, remaining true to the Party, and led them to increase the grain production.
					
					 The book also carries stories about his noble revolutionary obligation, warm comradeship and lofty popular traits. 
					
					 It also edits reminiscences telling about the moving stories that he made sure that the talks between the Red Cross organizations of the north and the south, the first of its kind in the history of the national division, were held to open the gate to the first dialogue.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group Hell-bent on Confrontation with Compatriots Flayed
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group Hell-bent on Confrontation with Compatriots Flayed
Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- The conservative ruling forces of south Korea, taking issue with the DPRK's re-operation of its nuclear facilities and reprocessing of spent fuel rods, talked nonsense that "the danger of nuclear proliferation in the north poses a worldwide problem" and that the international community should "tighten sanctions." They went the lengths of sending their lackeys to the ministerial meeting of the Coordinating Committee of the Non-Aligned Movement held in Cuba in a desperate bid to slander and debase the DPRK over its satellite launch. Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Sunday observes:  This was nothing but a disgusting behavior of the traitors to do harm to compatriots and realize their ambition for confrontation with them in collusion with outside forces, utterly indifferent to the dignity and interests of the nation. 
					 The news analyst goes on: 
					
					 Absolutely intolerable is the treacherous behavior of the Lee Myung Bak group keen to do harm to fellow countrymen at any cost in collusion with outside forces in a bid to realize its sinister intention, daring challenge the sovereignty of the DPRK. 
					
					 Nobody is entitled to take issue with the DPRK's resolute measure to reconstruct its nuclear facilities to their original state and reprocess the spent fuel rods as it is an exercise of the legitimate right of the sovereign state to cope with the grave situation created by the unjust action of the UNSC. 
					
					 As evidenced by the fact that south Korea which has no full membership made its way to the ministerial meeting of the NAM Coordinating Committee, the Lee group is the group of traitors which leaves no mean untried to impair the high authority and prestige of the DPRK and internationalize the racket of confrontation with the DPRK, unaware of its poor position and where it stands at present.   The Lee group obsessed with dependence on outside forces and confrontation with fellow countrymen is the root cause of disaster that should not be allowed to remain within the nation. 
					
					 In order not to let the disgraceful history of the nation in which Korea was reduced to a stateless nation due to flunkeyism and dependence on outside forces repeat itself the DPRK will further bolster its nuclear deterrent for self-defence and mercilessly punish on behalf of the nation the gang daring challenge it.

articles.title: Minju Joson Flails Lee Myung Bak Group's Sycophancy and Treachery
articles.content:
Minju Joson Flails Lee Myung Bak Group's Sycophancy and Treachery
Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- Traitor Lee Myung Bak, addressing a recent "meeting" marking the 60th anniversary of the south Korean puppet marine corps, blustered that south Korea would "pool efforts with the international community" to settle the "missile and nuclear issues of the north." Earlier, during his junket to Southeast Asia, he implored neighboring countries for "close and positive cooperation" and "unanimous counteraction." The minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade of south Korea, when meeting his Japanese counterpart, also let loose a spate of balderdash that "he would make efforts for the solution of the north's nuclear issue."
					 Minju Joson Sunday observes in a signed commentary in this regard: This was a revelation of despicable sycophancy and treachery of the traitors whose job is to do harm to fellow countrymen and stifle them in collusion with outside forces.
					
					 Such issues as the "nuclear issue" and "missile issue" are a product of the moves for aggression and war stepped up by the U.S. and Japanese reactionaries in a sinister bid to force the DPRK to disarm itself and invade it, the commentary notes, and goes on: 
					
					 The nuclear and missile rows kicked up by the Lee group are nothing but mean sycophantic and traitorous acts to do harm to fellow countrymen and stifle them at any cost in support of outsiders' moves for invading the DPRK.
					
					 It was none other than the Lee group which openly called for a full participation in the U.S.-led PSI under the pretext of the DPRK's satellite launch for peaceful purposes.
					
					 The Lee group's reckless remarks that "south Korea pools efforts with the international community" and "works for cooperation and unanimous counteraction" patently prove that they are going reckless, bereft of reason, to do harm to compatriots and stifle them in collusion with outside forces.
					
					 Nobody can guess what disasters the Korean nation will have to suffer if such group of traitors is allowed to go scot-free. 
					
					 The Lee group would be well advised to bear in mind that its persistent pursuance of sycophancy and treachery and confrontation with the DPRK would only precipitate its own self-destruction.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Il Sung's Work Observed
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Il Sung's Work Observed
Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung made public the historic work "On the Three Principles of National Reunification" on May 3, Juche 61 (1972) while having a conversation with the south Korean delegates to the high-level political talks between the north and the south held in Pyongyang. He laid down the three principles of national reunification-- independence, peaceful reunification and great national unity.
					 Rodong Sinmun Sunday dedicates a signed article to this anniversary.
					
					 It says:
					
					 The three principles of national reunification serve as a charter of reunification common to the nation indicating the most correct way of independent national reunification as they reflect the aspiration and desire of the nation for the peace of the country and peaceful reunification and they are based on a scientific analysis of the essence and character of the issue of national reunification and the main requirements and principled issues related to the struggle of the Korean people for achieving national reunification.
					
					 Basing himself on the above-said three principles, Kim Il Sung newly set out the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo and the 10-point programme of the great unity of the whole nation, arousing the whole nation to the dynamic struggle for implementing them.
					
					General Secretary Kim Jong Il formulated the three principles of national reunification, the 10-point programme of the great unity of the whole nation and the proposal for founding the DFRK as the three charters for national reunification to be held fast to by the Korean nation and has energetically led all Koreans to carry out the last instructions of Kim Il Sung for national reunification. Kim Jong Il also provided the nation with the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration, a great programme for independent national reunification, and the October 4 declaration, a programme for its implementation.
					
					 The June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration are the declarations for independence, peaceful reunification and great national unity, embodiments of the three principles of national reunification clarified by Kim Il Sung and a milestone of national reunification in the 21st century. 
					
					 Big hurdles and difficulties are lying in the way of national reunification due to the anti-reunification acts and moves for confrontation with the DPRK pursued by outside aggression forces and their stooges Lee Myung Bak group, but the Korean nation is optimistic about the prospect of national reunification. 
					
					 All Koreans in the north and the south and overseas should unite close as one under the banner of the three principles of national reunification and the north-south joint declarations and dynamically wage a nationwide patriotic movement for the reunification of the country in order to accomplish the historic cause of independent national reunification without fail.

articles.title: Large-Scale Anti-"Government" Actions in South Korea
articles.content:
Large-Scale Anti-"Government" Actions in South Korea
Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- "May Day All-People's Rally" was held in Youido, Seoul, on May 1.
					It was attended by members of at least 500 civic and public organizations and political parties including the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions and more than 50,000 citizens.
					
					 The KCTU in a declaration issued at the rally accused the Lee Myung Bak "government" of working hard to enact the "MB (Lee Myung Bak) Evil Law" aimed at serving the privileged circle which accounts for just one percent of the population while depriving the workers and the common people of their lives under the pretext of the economic crisis.
					
					 The declaration called for staging social solidarity actions in order to put an end to the unpopular misrule of the authorities.
					
					 Noting that people from all walks of life have the experience of waging a dynamic solidarity struggle against the import of American beef last year, holding candle lights, the declaration called upon all the progressive forces to unite close as one and launch again an anti-Lee Myung Bak solidarity struggle, holding high candle lights.
					
					 Speeches were made there by representatives of people from all walks of life.
					
					 The rally made public "10 major demands" such as the repeal of "MB Evil Law," a halt to the retrogressive revision of "law on irregular jobs" and "law on minimum wages," retraction of "motion calling for the National Assembly's ratification of FTA" between south Korea and the U.S., probe into the truth about the Ryongsan tragedy, cancellation of the plan to fully participate in the PSI, implementation of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, etc.
					
					At the end of the rally more than 2,000 members of the KCTU and civic and public organizations and youth and students, netizens occupied the roads in the area of Jongro Street and staged a fierce demonstration.
					
					 May Day witnessed simultaneous mass actions in different parts of south Korea in demand of the resignation of the Lee Myung Bak regime. A "preparatory committee for national students actions" grouping the south Korean Federation of University Student Councils, the students committee of the Democratic Labor Party, the "south Korean Federation of Students in the 21st Century" and others held a rally in the playground of Sungsil University in Seoul before launching an intensive students struggle for judging the Lee Myung Bak puppet regime.

articles.title: Evacuees Killed in Ryongsan Remembered
articles.content:
Evacuees Killed in Ryongsan Remembered
Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- A meeting was held in Seoul on April 29 to remember the evacuees who were brutally killed due to the Lee Myung Bak fascist clique's bestial suppression.
					 Attending it were Catholics, Christians, Buddhists and believers of four orders of Round Buddhism, members of political parties and civic and social organizations and bereaved families of the victims.
					
					 Speakers at the meeting said that 100 days have passed since the tragedy in Ryongsan, but the Lee "government" has not punished any man-killers, far from probing the truth about it in this period. 
					
					 A scrutiny into the dead bodies of those killed showed that their wrists, ankles and teeth were left broken and there were fractures in their skulls, they noted, adding that this proved that the evacuees met tragic deaths due to the brutal violence by police and gangsters of the evacuation team.
					
					 They urged Lee Myung Bak to make a proper apology to the bereaved families of the victims and the people and probe the truth about the case at once.
					
					 An appeal released at the meeting noted that the people from all walks of life in south Korea had a strong will to carry on their struggle till the truth behind the Ryongsan incident has been probed and the prime mover of the killing punished.
					
					 Those who desire a new democratic world where human rights are guaranteed and everyone enjoys equal freedom free from any discrimination should turn out and fight in firm solidarity to build it, the appeal stressed.

articles.title: DPRK's Satellite Launch Hailed by British Political Parties
articles.content:
DPRK's Satellite Launch Hailed by British Political Parties
Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- The New Communist Party of Britain and the Communist Party of Great Britain (Marxist-Leninist) released a joint statement titled "The satellite launch is a sovereign right of the DPRK" on April 21.
					 The statement recalled that the U.S. and its followers including Japan, Britain and south Korea are kicking up a hysteric campaign against the DPRK though the satellite launch is a sovereign right of the DPRK to achieve peaceful development and the UNSC issued a "presidential statement" critical of the satellite launch, yielding to their pressure. 
					
					 It strongly rejected the above-said statement and expressed full support to the stand of the DPRK that it would not take part in the six-party talks anymore but re-operate its nuclear facilities. 
					
					 Noting that it is an important requirement for protecting peace and stability not only on the Korean Peninsula but in the rest of the world to defend the DPRK, the statement called on all workers and progressive people of the world to turn out in the struggle to defend the DPRK.
					
					 Meanwhile, the British Branch of the Korean Friendship Association headquartered in Spain also released a statement on April 9 hailing the successful launch of the satellite Kwangmyongsong-2.

articles.title: April Holidays of DPRK Observed in Different Countries
articles.content:
April Holidays of DPRK Observed in Different Countries
Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- Korean book, photo and art exhibitions and lectures were held in Nigeria, Brazil, Democratic Congo and Belgium between April 13 and 27 to commemorate the 97th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung, the 16th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and the 77th founding anniversary of the Korean People's Army.
					 Displayed in the venues of the exhibitions were works of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, photos showing their immortal exploits, books, photos and art works representing the wisdom and skills of the Korean people and successes made in the drive to build a great prosperous and powerful socialist nation.
					
					 The director for the Art and Cultural Council of the Nigerian Ministry of Federal Capital Territory said in a speech made at the opening ceremony of a photo exhibition that Kim Il Sung liberated the country and made a great contribution to the socialist construction in the DPRK and the efforts to accomplish the cause of human independence.
					
					 The mayor of a city of the Brasilia Federal District of Brazil highly praised Kim Jong Il as the greatest statesman in the present times as he has turned the DPRK into a political and military power with his original Songun politics and firmly protected the dignity and sovereignty of the country, stalwartly standing up against the U.S. styling itself the world's "only superpower."
					
					 Kanga Ngerien Jerom, chairman of the Group for the Study of Kim Jong Il Juche Idea of Democratic Congo, said in a lecture that Kim Il Sung built a socialist power, independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in defence, on the land of Korea where the popular masses became its master and always shared weal and woe with the people, mixing with them all his life.
					
					 Meanwhile, a seminar took place in Mongolia, round-table talks in the Czech Republic and a lecture in Germany between April 23 and 25 on the occasion of the 77th founding anniversary of the KPA.
					
					 A message of greetings to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the function held in Mongolia.

articles.title: Koreans in Japan Hold Seminar
articles.content:
Koreans in Japan Hold Seminar
Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- The Korean Social Scientists Association in Japan held a seminar on the greatness of Generalissimo Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il at the Korean Media Hall in Tokyo on April 30 on the occasion of the DPRK's April holidays.
					 Speakers at the seminar noted that the immortal revolutionary exploits of Kim Il Sung are brightly shining in the homeland and his lifelong desire has been translated into a reality thanks to the energetic and distinguished Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The reelection of Kim Jong Il as chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission at the first session of the 12th Supreme People's Assembly is an expression of the absolute trust in him by all the people in the homeland and immense joy of the overseas compatriots, they said, and went on:
					
					 The first session of the 12th SPA marked an occasion of a great turn and a historic event in the efforts to develop the DPRK government into a powerful political weapon for upholding the Songun politics of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Noting that the successful launch of the satellite Kwangmyongsong-2 was another auspicious event of the nation recorded in the history of the motherland, they declared that it helped the DPRK reinforce its status as a satellite-launcher and satellite-possessor in the world.
					
					 Assailing the hostile forces including the U.S. for committing illegal provocative act of infringing upon the sovereignty of the DPRK by abusing the UN Security Council, they voiced full support for the legitimate stand and just counteraction of the DPRK against it.
